sections: The clichÃ© of a roadcrash interview is over-used. But Ashley Feinberg of
interview with Twitter co-founder Jack Dorsey

is a genuine example of the genre. So many of his responses are either utterly incoherent or just plan jaw-dropping, that I could choose any of them as an illustrative quote. But let's go for this one:
OK, but if Trump tweeted out asking each of his followers to murder one journalist, would you remove him?
That would be a violent threat. Weâ€™d definitely ... You know weâ€™re in constant communication with all governments around the world. So weâ€™d certainly talk about it.
I've been skeptical about Dorsey since I read Nick Bilton's compelling book
but this does much to confirm that much of Twitter's muddled response to some serious issues with the platform is coming from the top.
